TITLE: European Space Agency welcomes 5 new astronauts to its fourth class after receiving over 20,000 applicants
SUMMARY: The European Space Agency has formed its fourth class since 1978 with 5 Europeans who have completed basic astronaut training along with a graduate from the Australian Space Agency.

TITLE: Hollywood handbag designer sentenced to 18 months in prison for smuggling crocodile handbags into the US
SUMMARY: Celebrity handbag designer from Colombia, Nancy Gonzalez, has pleaded guilty to smuggling crocodile handbags into the U.S. and has been sentenced to 18 months in prison.

TITLE: 4 dead, 10 missing as torrential rains drench southern China
SUMMARY: At least 4 people have been killed and 10 others are missing after torrential rain swept across southern China; Zhaoqing city and Shaoguan city are among the hardest hit areas.

TITLE: Turkish President makes first official visit to Iraq in over a decade
SUMMARY: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan has arrived in Iraq for his first official visit since 2011; Ankara seeks cooperation in its fight against a Kurdish militant group.

TITLE: Poland 'ready' to host NATO members’ nuclear weapons to counter Russia, president says
SUMMARY: Polish President Andrzej Duda said his country would be ready to host the nuclear weapons of NATO's other members; this comes in response to Russia's movement of nuclear weapons to Belarus.

TITLE: Dozens detained by Greek police in soccer violence crackdown
SUMMARY: Multiple homes in Greece have been raided by police, and dozens have been detained in a crackdown on deadly violence at soccer matches.

TITLE: Chinese military leader takes harsh line on Taiwan, other disputes at international naval event
SUMMARY: Zhang Youxia, one of the top military leaders in China, took a harsh line on territorial disputes at an international navel gathering Monday in northeastern China.

TITLE: UK climate activist won't be charged for sign telling jurors to vote their conscience
SUMMARY: A judge has ruled that Trudi Warner cannot be charged with contempt of court for holding up a sign outside of a courtroom that reminded jurors of their right to acquit defendants.

TITLE: Thousands in central Russia plagued by flooding as rivers start to recede
SUMMARY: Flooding remains widespread in central Russia as water levels of some overflowing rivers have started to decrease; 5,000 properties are flooded in Russia's Kurgan region.

TITLE: Blinken, ahead of China visit, calls out Beijing’s ongoing 'genocide' against minority Muslims
SUMMARY: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken is reported to have alleged that Beijing is still committing genocide against Uyghur Muslim minorities.

TITLE: Burma’s vice president steps down for unspecified health reasons
SUMMARY: Burmese Vice President Henry Van Thio is stepping down from his post for unspecified health reasons; details were not provided about his health or who his successor will be.

TITLE: Peruvian psychologist Ana Estrada, who fought in courts for 'death with dignity,' has died by euthanasia
SUMMARY: Peruvian psychologist Ana Estrada, who suffered from an incurable disease and fought in courts for years for the right to 'die with dignity,' has died by euthanasia.

TITLE: Thousands of Indigenous people gather in Brazil to protest Lula's land grant decisions
SUMMARY: Indigenous groups gathered on Monday in Brazil's capital to protest against unfulfilled promises by President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva to expel land-grabbers and create reserves.

TITLE: Georgian opposition parties urge mass protests against 'Russian' bill
SUMMARY: Six Georgian opposition parties appealed last week for mass protests against a bill on "foreign agents" which they say aims to block the South Caucasus country's path towards the European Union and NATO.

TITLE: US and South Korea to hold talks in Hawaii on cost sharing for American troops
SUMMARY: U.S. and South Korean officials are meeting in Hawaii to discuss sharing the cost of maintaining American troops in South Korea. The U.S. delegation is led by Linda Specht.

TITLE: North Korea tests missile arsenal, has date circled on calendar for more possible provocations, experts say
SUMMARY: After North Korea conducted a new missile test on Monday, experts warn the hermit country has a date circled on its calendar for more possible provocations.

TITLE: UN plastic pollution treaty talks approach deadline in Canada
SUMMARY: In Canada, the United Nations’ Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee for Plastics must decide on the scope of a treaty to limit global plastics pollution.

TITLE: North Korea runs simulation nuclear counterstrike against foreign enemies
SUMMARY: The North Korean military debuted its "nuclear trigger" system on Monday near Pyongyang, activating a simulated nuclear counterstrike launch against foreign enemies.

TITLE: German lawmaker's aide arrested on suspicion of spying for China in European Parliament
SUMMARY: A German man who was working for a far-right lawmaker in the European Parliament has been arrested on suspicion of spying for China, officials confirmed.

TITLE: Haiti's health system pushed to the brink of collapse by rampant gang violence
SUMMARY: Life-saving medication and equipment are scarce in Haiti's Port-au-Prince hospitals and clinics due to escalating gang control, according to health officials.

TITLE: UK pledges $620M in new military aid for Ukraine, officials say
SUMMARY: The U.K. has pledged an additional $620 million in military supplies for Ukraine, including long-range missiles and ammunition, according to British officials.

TITLE: 23 arrested in Bosnia on suspicion of ties to global drug kingpin's 'inner circle'
SUMMARY: Law enforcement in Bosnia have arrested 23 people suspected of ties to a global drug kingpin. The crackdown targeted criminal networks dominating Europe’s cocaine trade.

TITLE: Authorities seize 1.4 tons of cocaine in one of Sweden's largest-ever drug busts
SUMMARY: Swedish authorities conducted one of the country's largest cocaine seizures to date, confiscating approximately 1.4 tons of the drug near Stockholm last week.

TITLE: Malaysian helicopters collide in military training exercise, killing all 10 crew
SUMMARY: The Malaysian navy’s 90th anniversary celebration has been canceled after 10 officers died when two helicopters collided and crashed while rehearsing for the event.

TITLE: Vietnam implements new rice farming techniques in effort to mitigate methane emissions
SUMMARY: Vietnam is aiming to transform its rice sector, making it more resilient to climate change while also reducing its emissions of methane, a greenhouse gas.

TITLE: South Korean man receives jail time for 'indescribably cruel' killing of 76 cats
SUMMARY: A man has been sentenced to prison for killing 76 cats in a case described as one of the most gruesome acts of animal cruelty in recent years in South Korea.

TITLE: Memorial opens on site of former Nazi concentration camp following government removal of farm
SUMMARY: A new memorial has opened in the Czech Republic on the site of a former Nazi concentration camp for Roma, capping a process that took decades, officials said.

TITLE: UK plan to send migrants to Rwanda criticized by human rights groups after Parliament backs new law
SUMMARY: Britain's decision to send asylum-seekers to Rwanda has drawn criticism from humanitarian organizations. The UK government claims the move will deter illegal crossings.

TITLE: While Iran attacked Israel, morality police flooded its streets to suppress dissent, activists say
SUMMARY: The same day that Iran launched its attack on Israel, it also launched a crackdown on dissent within its own borders and flooded the streets of Tehran with morality police.

TITLE: China spending 'drastically more' on military than declared, US admiral says
SUMMARY: Admiral John Aquilino expressed concern over China's military spending and criticized its aggressive actions in the South and East China Seas.

TITLE: Spain approves plans for sexual abuse victims of Catholic Church to be compensated financially
SUMMARY: Victims of sexual abuse connected to the Catholic Church in Spain will now be financially compensated after an economical plan was approved by the Spanish Court.

TITLE: Aboriginal spears in England have been returned to Australia's Indigenous people after repatriation request
SUMMARY: Four spears belonging to the Aboriginal Australians have been returned to the Indigenous community after being taken by Captain Cook in 1770 and presented to Trinity College in Cambridge.

TITLE: Spain reopens inquiry into Pegasus spyware case following France's request to collaborate on a similar case
SUMMARY: Spain's National Court has reopened a probe concerning the alleged use of Pegasus spyware on Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez after a French request for collaboration on a similar investigation.

TITLE: North Korea issues nuclear 'warning signal' to US, South Korea
SUMMARY: The Haekbangashoe system, known as the "nuclear trigger," oversees North Korea's military posture to respond to any nuclear attack, even though the country has approved pre-emptive strikes.

TITLE: Legal challenge over British government's role in weapons sales to Israel will proceed
SUMMARY: A U.K. judge said Tuesday that a legal challenge over the government's role in allowing arms to be sent to Israel can be heard at the High Court in October.

TITLE: Morocco wants to become an aviation hub, but airplane makers struggle to meet demand
SUMMARY: Moroccan officials want to grow the country's aviation industry, as companies like Airbus and Boeing outsource production, design and maintenance to countries from Thailand to Mexico.

TITLE: Zelenskyy says Russian missile strike on Kharkiv's TV tower part of intimidation campaign
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday said a Russian strike on a TV tower in Kharkiv was part of an effort to intimidate the city and limit its access to information.

TITLE: Hospital begs for snakebite victims to stop bringing in serpents when seeking help: 'Puts the staff at risk'
SUMMARY: Australian health authorities have asked for victims of snakebites to stop trying to interact with the potentially venomous creatures more than they already have.

TITLE: Paris mayor confident River Seine's water quality good enough for Olympic swimming
SUMMARY: Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo expressed confidence Tuesday that the River Seine's water quality will allow for Olympic swimming this summer.

TITLE: Paris Charles de Gaulle airport unveils new baggage handling system ahead of Olympics
SUMMARY: Paris Charles de Gaulle airport has unveiled a new baggage handling system ahead of the 2024 Olympic Games, which includes a revamped scanner system.

TITLE: Italian Senate approves law allowing anti-abortion groups to access women considering procedure
SUMMARY: Italy's Senate approved a law Tuesday allowing anti-abortion groups access to public support centers where women who are considering ending their pregnancies go to receive counseling.

TITLE: Greek skies turn orange as dust clouds roll in from Sahara Desert
SUMMARY: Skies over Greece's capital, Athens, turned an orange hue Tuesday as strong winds carried dust from the Sahara Desert across the Mediterranean Sea.

TITLE: 2 former UN employees charged in conspiracy to sell military equipment in Libya
SUMMARY: Canadian police said Tuesday that two former UN employees in Montreal have been charged in a conspiracy to sell military equipment in Libya between 2018 and 2021.

TITLE: Armenia and Azerbaijan move toward normalized relations as the first border marker is placed
SUMMARY: Experts in Armenia and Azerbaijan have worked to distinguish boundaries and have placed the first border marker as the nations strive for a peace treaty after a six-week war in 2020.

TITLE: Haitian officials scramble to impose security measures with council inauguration imminent
SUMMARY: A transitional council in Haiti in charge of selecting a new cabinet and PM says members must be sworn in at Haiti’s National Palace; gangs control most of the surrounding area.

TITLE: EU unable to determine impact of refugee funds given to Turkey, auditors say
SUMMARY: European Union auditors have said they are unable to determine the impact of the billions of euros the bloc gave to Turkey to help it cope with migrants crossing in from Syria.

TITLE: Thousands protest in Argentina as Milei's austerity plan hits universities
SUMMARY: Students and professors in Argentina protested austerity measures en masse Tuesday amid a worsening budget crisis at the country's public universities.

TITLE: Australia counterterrorism force arrests 7 teenagers following Sydney bishop stabbing
SUMMARY: Australia reportedly has arrested seven teens who allegedly believe in a religiously motivated extremist ideology and have ties to a church stabbing suspect.

TITLE: Mexico is the 'champion' of fentanyl production, head of country's detective service says
SUMMARY: The head of Mexico's detective service has acknowledged the country is “the champion" of fentanyl production. The country's president has long denied this claim.

TITLE: German lawmaker to dismiss assistant arrested for alleged Chinese espionage, continue election bid
SUMMARY: Maximilian Krah, a far-right lawmaker in Germany, has announced plans to dismiss his assistant, Jian Guo, who was arrested on suspicion of spying for China.

TITLE: London police capture 2 horses roaming city streets, with more believed to be on the run
SUMMARY: In London, two military horses were found running loose without riders in the city center, while others are still unaccounted for. Seven horses initially escaped.

TITLE: United Nations demands investigation after mass graves discovered at 2 Gaza hospitals raided by Israel
SUMMARY: The U.N. called for an independent investigation into mass grave sites that were discovered at two hospitals in Gaza after Israeli forces withdrew.

TITLE: Israeli minister torches Biden's 'harmful' leadership: 'I'd vote for Trump'
SUMMARY: An Israeli government minister torched the current Biden administration and said exactly what he would do if he was an American with the right to vote.

TITLE: Slovakia's public broadcasting overhaul allows government to control media, critics say
SUMMARY: Slovakia's Prime Minister Robert Fico has faced intense backlash for his decision to overhaul the country's public radio and television services.

TITLE: Europe must keep increasing aid to Ukraine after US approves new military help, German leader says
SUMMARY: Europe must continue to step up its help for Ukraine even after the approval of a U.S. aid package, according to German Chancellor Olaf Scholz. Scholz spoke in Berlin.

TITLE: China prepares to send 3 astronauts to Tiangong space station as part of new program and moon exploration
SUMMARY: China's space agency has set up a new program with the intent of sending people to the moon by 2030 and the Tiangong space station is making its final preparations to achieve this goal.

TITLE: IAEA experts review treated radioactive wastewater from Fukushima nuclear power plant in Japan
SUMMARY: Experts from the United Nations nuclear agency have inspected the treated radioactive wastewater that has been discharged into the Pacific from Japan's Fukushima nuclear plant.

TITLE: Venezuelan opposition presidential candidate says he would free political prisoners, bring home exiles
SUMMARY: Venezuelan opposition presidential candidate Edmundo Gonzalez said that, if elected, he would guarantee the freedom of political prisoners and the return of those exiled.

TITLE: Arrest made after 3 injured in 'major incident' at school in Wales, police say
SUMMARY: Welsh police say a suspect has been arrested after three people were injured in a “major incident" at a school in Wales. Additional details were not disclosed by police.

TITLE: Greek lawmaker will face criminal charges after physical altercation with a colleague in Parliament
SUMMARY: Greece's parliamentary speaker, Constantine Tassoulas, plans to seek charages against a Greek lawmaker who allegedly punched a colleague outside the debate chamber in Parliament.

TITLE: Key NATO ally shocks with its 'single largest' pledge to Ukraine: 'They need our support'
SUMMARY: Ukraine has for months implored its allies to continue and, in some cases, increase aid to help push back Russia's invasion, often warning that Russian President Vladimir Putin will not stop if he succeeds.

TITLE: European Union will begin investigation to see if China is denying access to medical device market
SUMMARY: The European Union is set to investigate whether China is unfairly limiting and depriving certain companies in Europe access to the Chinese medical market.

TITLE: Ukraine sees first of new EU aid package worth about $50B
SUMMARY: Ukraine received its first tranche of financial support from the European Union as the rest of the new aid program is set to be approved.

TITLE: D-Day veteran, 100, dies before he can honor fallen comrades one more time
SUMMARY: Bill Gladden, a British army veteran who played a significant role in the D-Day landings during World War II, has died at the age of 100, his family confirmed.

TITLE: 19 bodies recovered off the coast of Tunisia after migrants attempted to cross the Mediterranean to Europe
SUMMARY: Another 19 bodies were found off the coast of Tunisia as more migrants continue to attempt the treacherous voyage across the Mediterranean Sea into Europe.

TITLE: Macron takes part in charity soccer game ahead of Paris Olympics
SUMMARY: French President Emmanuel Macron participated in a charity match on Wednesday alongside celebrity players and soccer legends at a club west of Paris.

TITLE: Israel’s Netanyahu says ‘antisemitic mobs’ have taken over America’s ‘leading universities’
Pakistani, Iranian leaders pledge to ramp up efforts at 'united front' against Afghanistan-based militants
SUMMARY: Pakistan and Iran pledged on Wednesday to develop a 'united front' against Afghanistan-based militants after a visit by Iran’s President Ebrahim Raisi to Islamabad.

TITLE: Poland's prosecutor general says previous government used powerful spyware against hundreds
SUMMARY: Polish prosecutor general Adam Bodnar told the parliament Wednesday that Pegasus spyware was used against hundreds of people under the country's former government.

TITLE: Ethnic Karen guerrilla fighters withdraw from Burmese border town army lost 2 weeks ago
SUMMARY: Guerrillas from the primary ethnic Karen fighting force in Burma have left the border town of Myawaddy just weeks after they forced the army to give up its defense.

TITLE: Russia sinks space nuke ban at UN amid rumors of Putin's orbital weapon
SUMMARY: The White House in February claimed that it had intelligence suggesting Russia was developing a space-based weapon that would destroy satellites and cause untold chaos.

TITLE: Italian Culture Ministry bans loans to Minneapolis Institute of Art over ancient statue dispute
SUMMARY: Italy’s Culture Ministry confirmed on Wednesday that it has banned loans to the Minneapolis Institute of Art because of an ongoing dispute over an ancient statue.

TITLE: Rwanda's Hope Hostel, which once housed genocide survivors, ready to take in migrants from UK
SUMMARY: After the British Parliament approved a bill this week allowing the deportation of some migrants to Rwanda, the East African country said it is ready to receive them.

TITLE: Saudi King Salman enters hospital for 'routine examinations,' state media says
SUMMARY: Saudi Arabia's King Salman, who assumed the throne in 2015, entered a hospital in the city of Jeddah on Wednesday for "routine examinations," according to state media.

TITLE: UK approached Botswana to take ‘unwanted immigrants,’ African country's foreign minister says
SUMMARY: Botswana's foreign minister Lemogang Kwape said on Tuesday that the African country declined a request by the U.K. to take some of their "unwanted immigrants."

TITLE: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez weighing resignation after wife targeted by judicial probe
SUMMARY: Left-wing Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez has said he will consider resigning after the launch of a judicial investigation into corruption accusations against his wife.

TITLE: Iran rejects Argentina's push to arrest interior minister for 1994 Jewish center bombing
SUMMARY: Iran has warned Argentina against "making baseless accusations" after Buenos Aires sought Interior Minister Ahmad Vahidi's arrest for his alleged involvement in a 1994 bombing.

TITLE: Togo cracking down on media, opposition ahead of parliamentary elections: report
SUMMARY: Amnesty International said in its annual report Wednesday that authorities in Togo have prevented civilians from protesting peacefully, and have repressed the media.

TITLE: North Macedonia to hold presidential runoff with center-right candidate in the lead
SUMMARY: North Macedonia will hold a presidential runoff on May 8 after no candidate secured enough support from voters to win outright; voting will coincide with parliamentary elections.

TITLE: France President Macron to outline vision for Europe as global power ahead of European Parliament elections
SUMMARY: As war rages in Ukraine and European Parliament elections approach, French President Emmanuel Macron is expected to share his vision for Europe as an assertive global power.

TITLE: Taiwan president-elect chooses new foreign, defense ministers as China annexation threats intensify
SUMMARY: In the face of continued aggression from China, Taiwan president-elect Lai Ching-te appointed new foreign and defense ministers. China sees Taiwan as its sovereign territory.

TITLE: More than 100 stranded whales return to the sea after rescue effort on Australian coast
SUMMARY: More than 100 long-finned pilot whales that beached on the western Australian coast have returned to sea while 31 died on the shore, according to a researcher.

TITLE: Venice begins charging entry fee for day-trippers to address tourism crisis
SUMMARY: Venice has launched a pilot program to charge day-trippers an entry fee that authorities hope will discourage visitors from arriving on peak days, officials say.

TITLE: 2 military horses in serious condition after breaking free, running loose across London
SUMMARY: Two military horses that bolted miles through the streets of London after being spooked by construction noise are in a serious condition, according to the British Army.

TITLE: German parliament votes to establish annual 'veterans' day' to recognize military service
SUMMARY: The German parliament has approved the establishment of an annual national "veterans' day" to honor those who have served in the military, officials say.

TITLE: 6 dead, 20 injured after explosion causes restaurant and hotel fire in eastern India
SUMMARY: A fire tore through a restaurant and hotel complex on Thursday in eastern India, killing at least six people and injuring 20 others, fire officials said.

TITLE: Hamas would lay down arms if an independent Palestinian state is established, militant group says
SUMMARY: Hamas is reportedly open to a five-year truce with Israel, willing to disarm and become a political party if a Palestinian state is formed along pre-1967 borders.

TITLE: Russian court fines TV presenter who threw 'almost naked' party over her calls for peace
SUMMARY: Anastasia Ivleeva, a TV presenter and actress, has been fined for social media posts advocating peace during Russia's invasion of Ukraine, officials said.

TITLE: Ukraine implements passport renewal restriction for military-age men outside the country
SUMMARY: Ukraine has announced that men of conscription age cannot renew their passports from outside the country in an effort to stem the outflow of potential soldiers.

TITLE: Burkina Faso's military massacred more than 200 civilians, Human Rights Watch says
SUMMARY: More than 2 million civilians, mostly children, have been displaced in the conflict between jihadis linked to al-Qaida and the Islamic State group and Burkina Faso's military.

TITLE: More than 100 inmates escape from Nigerian prison after heavy rains damage facility
SUMMARY: Heavy rains destroyed parts of a prison near Abuja, Nigeria, leading to the escape of over 100 inmates. The downpour damaged the facility's perimeter fence.

TITLE: Ariel Henry resigns as prime minister of Haiti as country continues to face deadly gang violence
SUMMARY: Ariel Henry resigned on Thursday as prime minister of Haiti as the country faces rampant gang violence that has killed or injured more than 2,500 people.

TITLE: Reporter’s Notebook: Ukraine’s Zelenskyy opens up on US aid, Israel, Trump
SUMMARY: Volodomyr Zelenskyy opens up on Biden's recent approval of a massive aid package for Ukraine, Donald Trump and Israel's fight against Iran and Hamas in Gaza.

TITLE: 2023 saw drastic surge in people facing acute hunger, UN report says
SUMMARY: A new report says nearly 282 million people in 59 countries suffered from acute hunger in 2023. The increase was due to deterioration in food security, officials say.

TITLE: Russia claims US pressured Turkish Airlines into preventing Russians from flying into Mexico
SUMMARY: A Russian official claimed that the United States was forcing Turkish Airlines to prevent Russians from flying into Mexico, but provided no evidence for the accusation.

TITLE: Iran court sentences popular rapper to death for involvement in protests, lawyer says
SUMMARY: A rapper in Iran who rose to fame after the 2022 death of Mahsa Amini and criticizing the Islamic Republic has been sentenced to death, his lawyer said.

TITLE: Russia may downgrade relations with US if its assets are confiscated, deputy foreign minister says
SUMMARY: The U.S. and some European countries are considering confiscating frozen Russian assets and using them to fund Ukraine. Russia said it was considering downgrading U.S. ties in response.

TITLE: France and the Philippines considering defense pact agreement, French envoy says
SUMMARY: France and the Philippines are set to initiate discussions next month for a defense pact that would allow troops to conduct exercises on each other's soil.

TITLE: Iran picks sides as anti-Israel protests rage across US universities: 'Deeply worried and disgusted'
SUMMARY: Iran has officially picked its side amid a clash between anti-Israeli agitators and law enforcement officers at elite colleges and universities across the United States.

TITLE: Portugal marks the 50th anniversary of the Carnation Revolution army coup that brought democracy
SUMMARY: Portugal on Thursday commemorated the 50th anniversary of the army coup that brought democracy to the European country; the Carnation Revolution ended a four-decade dictatorship.

TITLE: Scottish leader faces battle for survival after ending power-sharing deal over climate change clash
SUMMARY: Scottish leader Humza Yousaf's decision Thursday to end a power-sharing agreement with the Scottish Green Party has triggered events that could see him lose his job next week.

TITLE: Moroccan asylum seeker says he killed British 70-year-old 'for the people of Gaza'
SUMMARY: Ahmed Alid, 45, was convicted Thursday of fatally stabbing 70-year-old Terence Carney in Hartlepool, England. Alid reportedly told police he killed Carney "for the people of Gaza."

TITLE: Ukrainian duo heads to the Eurovision Song Contest with a message: We're still here
SUMMARY: Ukraine's entrants into the Eurovision Song Contest, the female duo of alyona alyona and Jerry Heil, set off from Kyiv for the pan-continental music competition on Thursday.

TITLE: Congo questions Apple over knowledge of conflict minerals in its supply chain
SUMMARY: Lawyers representing Congo said they are questioning Apple about its knowledge of 'blood minerals' from the country's east that could be smuggled into the tech company's supply chains.

TITLE: Massive policing for Paris Olympics to include security checks for some of the capital's residents
SUMMARY: Paris police chief Laurent Nunez said Thursday that anti-terrorism measures put in place to safeguard the Summer Olympics Opening Ceremony will 'apply to all buildings along the route.'

TITLE: Pentagon confirms US military has begun construction on Gaza humanitarian aid pier
SUMMARY: Pentagon press secretary confirmed Thursday that the U.S. military has started construction of a humanitarian aid pier off the coast of Gaza.

TITLE: Brazilian authorities bury deceased migrants who drifted in African boat to the Amazon
SUMMARY: Nine migrants from Mali and Mauritania were buried Thursday in a solemn ceremony in the Brazilian city of Belem; fishermen found the boat carrying the bodies on April 13 in Brazil.

TITLE: French air traffic controllers cancel strike, but Paris airport delays remain pervasive
SUMMARY: People travelling to and from Paris were subject to significant disruptions on Thursday, despite air traffic controllers having declined to commence an anticipated strike.

TITLE: AMLO calls gangs, cartels 'respectful people' who 'respect the citizenry'
SUMMARY: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador said Thursday that the country's gangs and cartels generally "respect the citizenry" in favor of killing each other.

TITLE: Belarus says it thwarted attempted Lithuanian drone strikes; Vilnius rebuffs claims
SUMMARY: Top-ranking Belarusian security official Ivan Tertel said Thursday that the country had stopped attempted drone strikes by Lithuania, which has denied the claim's validity.

TITLE: 155 dead in Tanzania amid El Niño-induced flooding
SUMMARY: 155 people have been reported dead and over 200,000 otherwise affected by widespread flooding in Tanzania following weeks' worth of heavy rain.

TITLE: Syrian Kurdish officials hand over 50 women and children linked to Islamic State group to Tajikistan
SUMMARY: Kurdish-led authorities in Syria handed over 17 women and 33 children, related to Islamic State militants, on Thursday to a delegation from Tajikistan for repatriation.

TITLE: Mexico City seeks to downplay the case of a serial killer suspect who kept women's bones in his room
SUMMARY: Mexico City prosecutors on Thursday sought to downplay a suspected serial killer's case; he allegedly targeted women for more than a decade and kept women's bones in his room.

TITLE: Ship comes under attack off coast of Yemen as Houthi rebel campaign appears to gain new speed
SUMMARY: Yemen's Houthi rebels attacked a ship in the Gulf of Aden on Thursday, in the latest assault over Israel's war on Hamas; a Houthi missile targeting a vessel was shot down the day before.

TITLE: Frustrated with Brazil's Lula, Indigenous peoples march to demand land recognition
SUMMARY: Thousands of Indigenous people marched in Brazil's capital of Brasília on Thursday; they called on the government to protect territories and officially recognize lands.

TITLE: Sails from iconic Moulin Rouge windmill in Paris collapse to ground: 'It lost his soul'
SUMMARY: The Moulin Rouge's iconic windmill lost its sails when they mysteriously fell off Thursday night outside of the historic Parisian cabaret club.

TITLE: Meet the members of a transitional council tasked with choosing new leaders for beleaguered Haiti
SUMMARY: A transitional council, made up of eight men and one woman who will appoint Haiti's new cabinet and PM, was installed on Thursday as the country faces soaring hunger and gang violence.

TITLE: Mexico's chief detective apologizes for 'inadequate' remark about country's fentanyl production
SUMMARY: The head of Mexico’s detective service has apologized for calling Mexico "the champion" of fentanyl and meth production this week, according to his office.

TITLE: Head of Vietnam's parliament resigns amid intense anti-corruption campaign
SUMMARY: Vuong Dinh Hue, the head of Vietnam’s parliament, has resigned as the country faces an ongoing anti-corruption campaign, according to state media reports.

TITLE: Somalia detains US-trained military unit over alleged theft of rations
SUMMARY: Somalia's government has taken action against members of its Danab commando unit for allegedly stealing rations donated by the U.S., according to officials.

TITLE: Russian defense minister proposes expanded military exercises in Asia to counter US security expansion
SUMMARY: Russia's defense minister has voiced the need for Russia and its allies in Asia to expand joint military exercises, citing what he perceives as a direct threat from the U.S.

TITLE: Sweden's defense committee recommends $5B increase in country's military budget by 2030
SUMMARY: Sweden's parliamentary committee has recommended increasing the military budget by nearly $5 billion until 2030 to improve air defenses and expand conscription.

TITLE: UK parliamentary researcher and alleged accomplice granted bail in espionage case linked to China
SUMMARY: A former U.K. Parliament researcher and his alleged accomplice have been granted bail after being charged with espionage for China, according to officials.

TITLE: Turkish court sentences Syrian woman to life in prison for deadly Istanbul bombing
SUMMARY: A Syrian woman has received a life sentence for her role in a 2022 explosion in Istanbul, Turkey, which killed six people and injured 99, officials say.

TITLE: South Korean police raid incoming medical association leader's office over prolonged strikes
SUMMARY: South Korean police on Friday conducted a raid on the office of Lim Hyun-taek, the incoming leader of the Korean Medical Association, according to authorities.

TITLE: Baby girl rescued from dead mother's womb following Israeli airstrike dies in Gaza hospital
SUMMARY: A premature baby girl who was rescued from her mother's womb after her mother was killed in an Israeli airstrike has died in a Gaza hospital, her uncle said.

TITLE: 10 confirmed dead after fire at Brazilian hotel, authorities say
SUMMARY: A fire started in a small hotel in Porto Alegre, Brazil, resulting in the deaths of at least 10 people. The hotel was known to provide affordable housing.

TITLE: Former Olympian Oscar Pistorius smiles in first spotting since prison release for killing model girlfriend
SUMMARY: The double-amputee athlete, who competed at the London Olympics in 2012, was granted parole after spending the last decade behind bars for the murder of his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp.

TITLE: British man linked to Russian mercenary group charged with plotting arson attack on London business
SUMMARY: A 20-year-old British man has been charged with conducting hostile activity to benefit Russia. He is accused of plotting to torch a London business connected to Ukraine.

TITLE: Russian journalist detained for posts criticizing the military, lawyer says
SUMMARY: A journalist for the Russian edition of Forbes magazine has been arrested in Khabarovsk on charges of spreading false information about the Russian military.

TITLE: Scottish leader says he won't resign amid fallout of decision to end power-sharing agreement
SUMMARY: Scotland's First Minister, Humza Yousaf, is facing intense political pressure after breaking a power-sharing agreement. Yousaf replaced Nicola Sturgeon in March 2023.

TITLE: Romanian court rules that Andrew Tate's trial on charges of rape and human trafficking can start
SUMMARY: A Romanian court has ruled that a trial can proceed in the case involving Andrew Tate, who is accused of human trafficking, rape and leading a criminal group.

TITLE: Outgoing Dutch prime minister visits Turkey's Erdogan in his bid for the NATO chief position
SUMMARY: Mark Rutte, the outgoing PM of the Netherlands, was seeking support in his bid for the position of NATO secretary general from Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Friday.

TITLE: Journalists sign manifesto in defense of Spanish PM and wife, criticize right-wing media, parties
SUMMARY: Several thousand Spanish journalists and writers signed an online manifesto in support of Socialist Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez and his wife after Sánchez announced he was considering resignation.

TITLE: Egypt sends delegation to Israel, its latest effort to broker a cease-fire between Israel and Hamas
SUMMARY: Egypt sent on Friday a high-level delegation to Israel, seeking to discuss a prolonged cease-fire agreement with Hamas and avert an Israeli offensive on the town of Rafah in Gaza.

TITLE: Pope to bring his call for ethical artificial intelligence to G7 summit in June in southern Italy
SUMMARY: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni has announced that Pope Francis will attend the G7 Summit in June and will participate in the session on artificial intelligence.

TITLE: At least 70 people killed by flooding in Kenya as more rain is expected through the weekend
SUMMARY: A government spokesperson in Kenya said on Friday that at least 70 people have been killed by flooding and heavy rains in the East African country since mid-March.

TITLE: Guatemalan prosecutors raid offices of Save the Children charity
SUMMARY: Guatemalan prosecutors have raided the offices of humanitarian organization Save the Children, citing a complaint alleging the charity violated the rights of migrant children.

TITLE: Mexican film wins top prize at Moscow International Film Festival while major studios boycott Russia
SUMMARY: Mexican film 'Shame' has won the top prize at the Moscow International Film Festival, as major studios in the U.S. and many European countries boycott the Russian market over its war in Ukraine.

TITLE: Burkina Faso suspends BBC, Voice of America radio stations over mass killing reports

SUMMARY: Amid Israel’s campaign to root out Hamas terrorists in Gaza, the terrorist organization is stoking “disinformation" to hoodwink the international community, claim critics.

SUMMARY: A climate activist who smeared paint on the protective case of Edgar Degas' "Little Dancer Aged Fourteen" sculpture at Washington, D.C.’s National Gallery of Art was charged.

SUMMARY: New details have emerged on American missionaries Davy and Natalie Lloyd, as well as Jude Montis, the local director of Missions In Haiti, Inc., who were fatally shot by gangs.

SUMMARY: The ground-based drones pose a great opportunity for new tactics, and can serve a great range of purposes, including the retrieval and transport of injured soldiers from the battlefield.

SUMMARY: The Gaza humanitarian aid pier project has run to a cost that is estimated at double its initial budget as additional hurdles drive the overall costs even higher, and aid delivery remains at a trickle.

SUMMARY: The U.S. State Department is asking China to "act with restraint" after the CCP ran provocative military drills near Taiwan on Friday, as tensions escalate in the region.

SUMMARY: The U.S. State Department is asking China to "act with restraint" after the CCP ran provocative military drills near Taiwan on Friday, as tensions escalate in the region.

TITLE: Indian military ramps up AI capabilities to keep up with regional powers
SUMMARY: India is making new financial investments in AI to aid its military. Delhi recently unveiled a robot that can remove unexploded shells and double as a stretcher for injured troops.

SUMMARY: Nawaf Salam, the Lebanese president of the International Court of Justice, faces fresh scrutiny over past anti-Israel comments made while serving as his country's ambassador to U.N

SUMMARY: Following an IDF strike that took out two senior Hamas terrorists, Israel announced it is investigating why innocent civilians were killed. On Monday, Netanyahu said something "went tragically wrong."

SUMMARY: Researchers digging in Jerusalem’s City of David recently have found a gold ring set with a red precious stone that is believed to be 2,300 years old.
